articles.title: Australia, New Zealand approve sale and use of Argentine GMO wheat
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, May 6 (Reuters) - Australia and New Zealand have approved the sale and use of foods that contain so-called HB4 wheat, a genetically modified (GMO) variety developed by Argentine firm Bioceres to withstand droughts and herbicides, the firm said on Friday.Argentina, one of the world's largest wheat exporters, was the first country to approve GMO wheat in 2020,
articles.content: BUENOS AIRES, May 6 (Reuters) - Australia and New Zealand have approved the sale and use of foods that contain so-called HB4 wheat, a genetically modified (GMO) variety developed by Argentine firm Bioceres to withstand droughts and herbicides, the fi... [1030 chars]

articles.title: Definition of 'inefficient fossil fuel subsidy' still elusive in Canada
articles.description: OTTAWA — Canada is still working on defining an "inefficient" fossil fuel subsidy, some 13 years after it signed an international agreement to eliminate them and four years since launching a peer review with Argentina to identify what subsidies exist

articles.title: Three million ticket requests for World Cup final; 1.4 million for England-U.S.
articles.description: FIFA swamped by ticked requests for World Cup final; 2.5 million requests to see Argentina play Mexico
articles.content:
FIFA has received three million ticket requests for the World Cup final in Qatar and high demand to attend some of its biggest group-stage games, even as issues linger about the tiny Persian Gulf nation’s ability to accommodate fans.
The data reveale... [3634 chars]

articles.title: ‘I believe’: The Cheika show returns as former Wallabies boss says Argentina can win World Cup
articles.description: ‘I believe’: The Cheika show returns as former Wallabies boss says Argentina can win World Cup
articles.content:
Michael Cheika has commenced his work with Argentina, where he will coach Los Pumas to the 2023 WOrld Cup. Photo: UAR
Former Wallabies coach Michael Cheika says Argentina can win next year’s World Cup.
“I believe,” Cheika said a number of times, look... [7146 chars]

articles.title: Dry weather to boost Argentina soybean harvest in coming days: BA grains exchange
articles.description: May 5 (Reuters) - Most of Argentina's farming areas will have little to no rainfall over the next seven days, the Buenos Aires Grains Exchange (BdeC) said on Thursday, which will help speed up the harvest of the 2021/22 soybean crop that has a production estimate of 42 million tonnes.Argentina is the world's leading exporter of soybean oil and meal, and the South American
